availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Wilson (Nelson County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Wilson. Father of Joseph Wilson, Fielder Wilson, Thomas Wilson, Margaret Wilson, Catherine Wilson, Ben Wilson, M. Wilson, Alex Wilson, Jack Wilson. Merchant in Nelson County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1850. Merchant in Nelson County in 1860. Employed Joseph Wilson as a clerk in Nelson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Nelson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 274B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 149.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 182.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 109B.
